Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (97.3%) toPMAP-37Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC25923 (MIC 0.049 ug/ml), S. epidermidis LY8 (MIC 25 ug/ml), L.monocytogenes CICC21533 (MIC 125 ug/ml), B. subtilis CICC24434 (MIC 1.56 ug/ml), Gram- S. choleraesuis C78-1 (MIC 0.78 ug/ml), S. typhimurium SL1344 (MIC 1.56 ug/ml), P. avium C48-3 (MIC 3.125 ug/ml), E. coli CICC10004 (MIC 25 ug/ml), and S. flexneri CICC21534 (MIC 75 ug/ml).Toxicity: 3% hemolysis till 1000 ug/ml (poor hemo.lytic). Little toxicity to NIH 3T3 till 1000 ug/ml.Animal model:mouse: more animal survived with the peptide treatment for 3 days.
Literature Information.Author: Zhou J, Liu Y, Shen T, Chen L, Zhang C, Cai K, Liu Z, Meng X, Zhang L, Liao C, Wang C.2019
Literature Information.Reference: Chem Biol Drug Des. 2019 Sep;94(5):1986-1999. doi: 10.1111/cbdd.13601.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Enhancing the antibacterial activity of PMAP-37 by increasing its hydrophobicity.
